column4: okay... /var/www/ is owned by root, but I want to add the a new group to have full access to var/www/... how do i do that???
Use symlinks to home dir.
What?
You don't symlink a group, you symlink a directory.
i just want this group of users to have full access to the /var/www/ directory
No you don't.
What are you trying to do?
You are running apache web server, right?
What in /var/www/ are you wanting to share?
I made a new group called www-admin... I added my admins to that group, I want them to have FULL ACCESS to the /var/www/ directory.
Are you serving webpages via apache from /var/www ?
yes.
Are they going to ftp in or ssh in or...?
How many sites?  One or more?
That is highly irregular... you  will have a bunch of  people all having access to 30 different sites?
How many users?
And those 3 users are already users on this server?  (They already have user accounts?)
yes. they are admins like me, but I am the main admin.
Iw ant them to have full access so I dont have to be on call 24/7 anymore.
Well, it is highly irregular, I've never done it but suppose  you could just use chmod to change group owner to it.
why is it irregular? I have 3 people in a new group that I want to have full access to a directory so they can admin too, so I dont hafta be on call 24/7 every effin second of the day.
But like I said, you should just use symlinks
